question.title: Apache Camel 4 Timeout Parameters passed on the URI and timeout is not enforced
question.body:
I am doing this on a Quarkus app using Camel 4:

.toD("https://endpoint?connectionsPerRoute=10&connectTimeout=2000&connectionRequestTimeout=2000%soTimeout=2000&responseTimeout=2000&bridgeEndpoint=true")

When i test the http call the timeout i set on the parameters is not enforced. After doing some digging on the monitoring tools i noticed that the timeout parameters are part of the URI of the call. How can i fix this in order for Apache Camel to interpet the parameter as HTTPClient configuration and not URI.

answers.body:
i'm using Camel 4.16.0

With this flow

from("timer://foo?fixedRate=true&delay=0&period=5000")
   .setVariable("url", constant("https://www.google.com?connectionsPerRoute=10&connectTimeout=2000&connectionRequestTimeout=2000&soTimeout=2000&responseTimeout=2000&followRedirects=true"))
   .setHeader(HttpConstants.HTTP_QUERY, constant("order=123&detail=short"))
   .toD("${variable.url}")
   .setHeader(FileConstants.FILE_NAME, constant("message.html"))
   .to("file:C:/tmp/google")
   .log("call end");

http timeout parameter are correctly set up.

I've also setup some query parameter to show the difference.

Enabling http debug log we can see that only order and detail are sent as http query params.

Also if i modify connectTimeout to 2 millis instead of 2 seconds, this modification is activated correctly and i receive http timeout error.
